title: Groomer selection page with services list (Chewy scheduler-inspired)

requirements.text: Create a scheduler-style UI flow (inspired by https://www.chewy.com/vet-care/scheduler) where the user can select a groomer and then view a list of services offered by that selected groomer.

quotes: https://www.chewy.com/vet-care/scheduler , use this as context , i'm looking for a page that list services from groomers once i select them

acceptanceCriteria: A dedicated page/screen exists that presents a list of groomers with clear selection affordances.
When a groomer is selected, the UI transitions (same page or next step) to display services for that groomer only.
The page includes a clear indicator of the currently selected groomer and an easy way to change the selection (e.g., back button or change groomer control).

requirements.text: Implement backend data and APIs to provide (1) the list of groomers and (2) the list of services for a given groomer, so the frontend can render real data rather than hardcoded UI-only state.

quotes: i'm looking for a page that list services from groomers once i select them

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a query method to list groomers.
Backend exposes a query method to list services for a specific groomer identifier.
Returned data includes stable identifiers and display names for groomers and services.
The backend can be initialized with seed/sample groomers and services so the UI is usable immediately after deployment.

requirements.text: Connect the groomer/services UI to the backend using React Query, including loading and error states for fetching groomers and services.

quotes: i'm looking for a page that list services from groomers once i select them

acceptanceCriteria: Groomer list loads from the backend and shows a loading state while fetching.
Selecting a groomer triggers fetching of that groomerâ€™s services from the backend and shows a loading state while fetching.
Errors fetching groomers or services are displayed in the UI with an option to retry.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, polished visual theme for the scheduler flow (colors, typography, spacing, and components) that feels modern and pet-care adjacent, and keep it consistent across the groomer selection and services list steps (do not use blue/purple as primary colors).
acceptanceCriteria: The groomer selection and services list screens share consistent typography, spacing, and component styling.
Primary/brand color is not blue or purple.
Layout is responsive and usable on mobile and desktop widths.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).

Do not edit files under frontend immutable paths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui); compose them instead.
nonGoals: Implementing appointment time-slot selection, calendar availability, or booking/checkout flows.
Implementing payments, notifications, or third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity.
Building an admin UI to manage groomers/services (seed/sample data is sufficient for this build).
